threats.title: Voting application unable to process the votes due to unavailability
threats.description:
- Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') can lead to a Dos.
- Uncontrolled Resource Consumption

threats.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
threats.description:
The software allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of
an actor without imposing any restrictions on the size or number of resources
that can be allocated, in violation of the intended security policy for that actor.

threats.title: Voting application unable  to process the votes due to unavailability
threats.description:
Caused by:
- Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
threats.mitigation:
- Autoscaling the web application so resources are allocated to where there is heavy traffic
- Rate Limiting

threats.title: Tampering of voting application by introducing malicious code
threats.description:
Caused by:
- Out-of-bounds Write
- Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
threats.mitigation:
Out-of-bounds Write:
- Implement proper data/input validation
- Use Memory-Safe Languages
Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type:
- Whitelist Allowed File Types

threats.title: Logs sensitive data
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Mask sensitive data and use generic responses

threats.title: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat

threats.title: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat

threats.title: Casting of multiple votes by the same user
threats.description:
Caused by:
- Improper input validation
- Missing Authorization
- Incorrect Authorization
- Insufficient session expiration
threats.mitigation:
- Implement logic to ensure only one vote per user can be made
- Ensure that logs are checked when a vote is made, to double check that there is no duplicate vote
- Make sure that access control mechanism is enforced correctly at server side on every page, users should not be able to access unauthorized functionalities by simply requesting access to the page
- Allow user to vote only once
- Use tokens that have a short life

threats.title: Modifying the candidates’ information participating in the election
threats.description:
Caused by: 
- Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
- Relative path traversal
- Improper Neutralization of  Input During Web Page  Generation ('Cross-site  Scripting')
- Improper Input Validation
- Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
- Out-of-bounds Write
threats.mitigation:
Path traversal/ Relative path traversal: 
- Implement proper data/input validation
XSS: 
- Input validation, for imported CSV’s
- Implement strong CPS (Content security policy) to block scripts from communicating with an external server
Improper input validation: 
- Implement proper data/input validation in the admin side.
- Use Memory-Safe Languages
- Apply Least Privilege

threats.title: Modifying the results of the election
threats.description:
Caused by: 
- Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
- Relative path traversal
- Improper Neutralization of  Input During Web Page  Generation ('Cross-site  Scripting')
- Improper Input Validation
- Out-of-bounds Write
- Missing Authorization
threats.mitigation:
Path traversal/ Relative path traversal: 
- Implement proper data/input validation
XSS: 
- Input validation, for imported CSV’s
-  Implement strong CPS (Content security policy) to block scripts from communicating with an external server
Improper input validation: 
- Implement proper data/input validation in the admin side.
- Use Memory-Safe Languages
- Require multi-sig approvals

threats.title: Exposure of election information to unauthorized parties
threats.description:
Caused by: 
- Improper Neutralization of  Special Elements used in an  SQL Command ('SQL  Injection'
- Improper Neutralization of  Input During Web Page  Generation ('Cross-site  Scripting') (XSS)
- Path traversal/ Relative Path traversal
- Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
threats.mitigation:
SQL Injection: 
- Input validation
- Apply principle of least privilege
XSS: 
- Disable inline JavaScript execution
Path traversal/ Relative Path traversal:
- Implement proper data/input validation for file paths
- Whitelist certain file paths
Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information :
- Enforce HTTPS connections & requests

threats.title: Premature termination of the online voting process
threats.description:
Caused by:
- Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
- Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
- Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime
threats.mitigation:
Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling:
- Rate Limiting
- Autoscaling
Uncontrolled Resource Consumption:
- Input Validation
Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime:
- Garbage Collection Monitoring

threats.title: Casting of vote by an attacker using a legitimate voter’s account
Session Hijacking
threats.description: Man in the Middle (MitM) or packet sniffing
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce HTTPS at the server-level by only accepting HTTPS requests
- Set HSTS headers
- Ensure that the “Secure”  flag is set to true for all sensitive cookies

threats.title: Obtaining the encryption keys that are hardcoded
threats.description:
- Insufficiently Protected Credentials
- Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Log File
threats.mitigation:
Insufficiently Protected Credentials:
- Use of Secret Management Tools
Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Log File
- Mask Information in Logs and Use Generic Responses

threats.title: Modifying the candidates’ information participating in the election
threats.description:
Relevant vulnerabilities: 
- Improper Neutralization of  Special Elements used in an  SQL Command ('SQL  Injection')
- Path traversal/Relative path traversal
threats.mitigation:
SQL Injection: 
-Query parameterization
Path traversal/Relative path traversal: 
- Implement proper data/input validation

threats.title: Leakage of voters’ personally identifiable information
threats.description:
Caused by: 
- Path Traversal/Relative Path traversal
- Improper Neutralization of  Input During Web Page  Generation ('Cross-site  Scripting') (XSS)
- Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
threats.mitigation:
Path Traversal/Relative Path traversal: 
- Input validation

XSS: 
- Encode output, especially special characters to prevent being read as code
- Implement strong Content security policy (CPS) to block scripts from communicating with an external server

Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information:
- Enforce HTTPS connections & requests

threats.title: Exposure of election information to unauthorized parties
threats.description:
Caused by: 
- Improper Neutralization of  Special Elements used in an  SQL Command ('SQL  Injection')
- Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute
- Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
threats.mitigation:
SQL injection:
- Query parameterization
- Enforce HTTPS sitewide
Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information:
- Enforce HTTPS Connections & Requests
